_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!

This Sunday, winter is showing its true colors in the mountains. Cold temperatures will persist, so make sure you’re dressed appropriately to stay warm and comfortable on the slopes!

Sunshine and light winds are in the forecast, creating excellent conditions for skiing, snowboarding, and alpine touring. Our teams have been hard at work preparing the mountain to deliver well-groomed runs and quality turns for everyone. Park riders will be glad to know that all four terrain parks remain open.

First Tracks: IKON Pass holders can enjoy first tracks starting at 7:30 a.m. On the North Side, early access will be via the Lowell Thomas and Expo lifts, and the Casino Gondola will open early at 7:15 a.m.

Please note: Due to the cold temperatures, the Duncan and Soleil lifts will open progressively throughout the morning. Moreover, snow conditions are variable due to the lack of snow over the past few days, as well as wind and cold temperatures. Thank you for your understanding, and be sure to check the Conditions page for the latest updates.

Cold winter air, sunshine, and a well-prepared mountain make for a great Sunday.
See you on the mountain!

Mountain safety tip of the week: Be careful when using the ski lifts.
Knowing how to board ski lifts is essential to ensure the safety of all users.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
Bonjour Tremblant!

The weather is very cold, so please be sure to dress warmly and layer up for comfort throughout the day.

Please note that some chairlifts and ski runs will open progressively throughout the day as conditions allow—thank you for your understanding as our teams work to deliver the best possible experience. Be sure to check the Snow Conditions page regularly for the latest updates.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: This sunday brings cold winter temperatures, sunshine, and light winds, creating great conditions on the mountain! IKON Pass holders can enjoy First Tracks starting at 7:30 a.m., with early access on the North Side via the Lowell Thomas and Expo lifts. The Casino Gondola opens at 7:15 a.m. Due to the cold, the Duncan and Soleil lifts will open progressively.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Ce dimanche s’annonce froid et ensoleillé avec des vents légers, offrant de très bonnes conditions en montagne. Les détenteurs de la passe IKON auront accès aux First Tracks dès 7 h 30, avec un accès matinal du côté Nord par les remontées Lowell Thomas et Expo. La Télécabine Casino ouvrira à 7 h 15. En raison du froid, les remontées Duncan et Soleil ouvriront progressivement.
